quotes.quote: We live in a world that has walls and those walls need to be guarded by men with guns.
If you reveal your secrets to the wind, you should not blame the wind for revealing them to the trees.
Security is the chief enemy of mortals.
Security and safety were the reward of dullness.
Security is not the absence of danger, but the presence of God,no matter what the danger.
If you're waiting until you feel talented enough to make it, you'll never make it.
The only real security that a man can have in this world is a reserve of knowledge, experience and ability.
Security is always excessive until it's not enough.
The opposite of security is insecurity, and the only way to overcome insecurity is to take risks.
True individual freedom cannot exist without economic security and independence. People who are hungry and out of a job are the stuff of which dictatorships are made.
Human security depends on a system where each rational individual calculates that it is more profitable not to rebel.
We have an illusion of security, we don't have security.
Only the insecure strive for security.
Security represents your sense of worth, your identity, your emotional anchorage, your self-esteem, your basic personal strength or lack of it.
Security is when everything is settled, when nothing can happen to you; security is the denial of life.
It is possible to provide security against other ills, but as far as death is concerned, we men live in a city without walls.
Those who deny freedom to others deserve it not for themselves.

Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing.
Security is no replacement for liberty.
Security depends not so much upon how much you have, as upon how much you can do without.
There is no real security except for whatever you build inside yourself.
The balance between freedom and security is a delicate one.
We must plan for freedom, and not only for security, if for no other reason than that only freedom can make security secure.
The good we secure for ourselves is precarious and uncertain until it is secured for all of us and incorporated into our common life.
It isn't for the moment you are struck that you need courage, but for that long uphill climb back to sanity and faith and security.
The ultimate security is your understanding of reality.
At the end of the day, the goals are simple: safety and security.
They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.
No one can build his security upon the nobleness of another person.
For a people who are free, and who mean to remain so, a well-organized and armed militia is their best security.
